summary.overall_findings: L3Harris Technologies' policy documents establish mandated usage restrictions and data protection rules for Generative AI, addressing the privacy pillar. Additionally, its Code of Conduct documents outline a commitment to considering equitable principles for AI, contributing to the fairness pillar, and require human review and approval for AI use under oversight. Overall, published materials address 5 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. These disclosures are drawn from 10 publicly available sources, with transparency, fairness, oversight, privacy, and governance all addressed at the policy level. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability or external accountability.
